Issues.Title: Transform component's children to its default slot contents (fix #12232)
Issues.Body:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [x] Yes
- [ ] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

HTML tags written using some uppercase letters (i.e. `<H1>` or `<Span>`) will stop rendering their children. This happens because those tags are considered components by the `maybeComponent()` function, so after applying these changes their children will be considered the contents of its default slot. As native HTML tags doesn't have slots, they won't be rendered. This is explained in more detail in the attached video.

The recommendation in this case is to write the standard HTML tags always in lowercase (in fact, in Vue 3 a "failed to resolve component" warning is displayed when an uppercase tag is used, even when it's still rendered).

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9889025/149219636-254a6ebf-7f56-4d76-9de6-d8eed439a1e0.mp4

*P.S.: I just realized I didn't show the fixed version working as expected in the video (I forgot to modify the input during the demo). If you find it necessary, I can upload another video showing it :slightly_smiling_face: thank you very much!*

Issues.Title: Data re-rendering caused by passed slots in v-for loop
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/embed/objective-rui-hw0c3?fontsize=14&hidenavigation=1&theme=dark)







### Steps to reproduce
Enter name of a fruit and click "Add fruit". When removing the passed "slot" it is working as expected.

### What is expected?
Neither on typing nor on adding timestamps should change because corresponding data isn't changed.

### What is actually happening?
Timestamps are updating during typing or when adding a new fruit

---
I figured out that the same issue occurs on Vue 3. Any ideas what I'm doing wrong here or how I can pass slots down to looped children without re-rendering everything when updating parent data? You help is highly appreciated, thanks!

Issues.Title: 子组件的根节点会被父组件的作用域样式影响【强烈建议取消这功能】
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
大部分时候组件都不想受到其它页面样式的影响。

组件的子节点好多时候是根据根节点的宽、高，颜色、背景颜色等等之类的布局的。
根节点一旦受到其它页面的样式影响，容易导致组件的子节点就开始发生错乱。

现在我为了定义不受其它页面的组件，不得不在根元素外面多添加一个没有必要的根节点。

而且想要调整该子组件布局，完全可以用props、style之类的达到目的。

### What does the proposed API look like?
https://codesandbox.io/s/youthful-bouman-9puy9?file=/src/components/Child.vue

如这里由于子组件样式受到父组件的影响。里面的文字已经看不清，一行的组件变成了两行。

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "子组件的根节点会被父组件的作用域样式影响【强烈建议取消这功能】" (#12412)

Issues.Title: Please add option eventType for watcher.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
in my context i'm trying to build an auto-saving feature.
and I have a model named "Form" this model is an object which contains a lot of properties for ex: name, age, address, etc...

so when i first tried to make the auto-saving feature i first thought of using the watch(), since it does exactly what i wanted to do. 
then i tested it, noticed its firing the handler on every input event. which is something we dont want because it'd be a heavy request to the backend/api. so i figured if we just add an eventType parameter in the watch() then we can specify which event should we listen to before firing the handler.

### What does the proposed API look like?
``
watch() {
 form: {
   deep: true,
   eventType: 'change',
   handler: 'formChangeHandler'
 }
}
``

for the api version of watch() it'd be
``
this.$watch(
 'form',
 'change',
 () => {
})``

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Please add option eventType for watcher." (#12411)

      Type '() => Promise<Component<DefaultData<never>, DefaultMethods<never>, DefaultComputed, Record<string, any>>>' is missing the following properties from type 'Promise<EsModule<Component<DefaultData<never>, DefaultMethods<never>, DefaultComputed, Record<string, any>>>>': then, catch, [Symbol.toStringTag], finally

Issues.Title: ci: Update CircleCI pipeline to run Codecov
Issues.Body:
<!--

https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->
This duplicates https://github.com/vuejs/vue/pull/12402 due to a branch deletion mistake.

Tom from Codecov here. The original intent of the build was to only run Codecov on non-PRs. But it seems like every commit has an associated PR now. The [Codecov page](https://app.codecov.io/gh/vuejs/vue) shows no commits for the past year, and viewing any build of a commit in that timeframe (e.g. [6e22f770](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/vuejs/vue/784/workflows/dd6d5796-ada9-44ff-9b4b-27dd8bb9558a/jobs/18103)) will show that `CIRCLE_PULL_REQUEST` and `CI_PULL_REQUEST` are set.

In any case, no coverage report has been uploaded in quite some time. I realize that this will change the PR experience for users, so happy to change this to whatever makes the most sense for Vue.

Issues.Title: vue3.0 怎么获取router-view渲染后的component组件实例?
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
代码：
<router-view ref="child" v-else></router-view>

vue2.0通过this.$refs.child可以直接调用渲染后子组件里的methods的方法

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.

```js
const routes = [
  {
    path: `/logout`,
    name: `login page`,
    component: Home, // () => import(`../views/Login.vue`),
  },
  {
    path: `/login`,

  },
]
```

I can provide a reproducible example if necessary 

Please make vue router warn about routes with same names

Issues.Title: Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/safari-scrollbehavior-gh2fx)







### Steps to reproduce
Click on the router-link in safari.

### What is expected?
Smooth scrolling

### What is actually happening?
Scroll quickly to an element

---
https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/cb4c16398bf25aaa2c5d755faa480ad1e81cd756/src/util/scroll.js#L164

This line returns `false`. I'm using a safari [polyfill](https://github.com/iamdustan/smoothscroll) that enables smooth scrolling with `window.scrollTo`, but smooth scrolling doesn't work because `vue-router` uses a different interface with two arguments.

`window.scrollTo(x, y)` instead of `window.scrollTo({ top, left })`

An even more interesting situation arises when you execute code in the browser console: `Object.keys(document.documentElement.style).includes('scrollBehavior')`

This code will return `true`, because the `scrollBehavior` key is present in the object.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists" (#3674)

Issues.Title: router.currentRoute.value is reset to homepage when saving with Vite HMR activated
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.12

### Reproduction link
[stackblitz.com](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vite-82dmj6?devtoolsheight=33&file=src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Create vue router add a route to it
Add it to Vue 
Navigate to said page, the value of the currentRoute is correctly set
Make any change to the componenet where currentRoute.value is called, save
The page will reload with Vite HMR
Value of the currentRoute is set to the homepage

### What is expected?
The currentRoute should still be equal to the route we are currently on

### What is actually happening?
The currentRoute value isn't properly set

---
Thought it had to do with params at first since it was the only time i was using currentRoute.value.params.xxx but it seems to affect every page.

I made a gif showing to situation for clarification : 

![Animation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26070848/143688237-5d116194-dd32-43ec-a98e-9cb992ad516c.gif)

Issues.Title: Delayed start for fetching routes data
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Some apps does not know routes structure in a compile time, but have to fetch some data in a run time. My use-case is content app which have to download content from CMS and then generate routes.

But currently in a meantime it reports "[Vue Router warn]: No match found for location with path". After routes loaded I have to call this.$router.replace(this.$route.fullPath).

### What does the proposed API look like?
Option like start: false in createRouter.
Method like router.start().

Or just document how to solve it by current API. There are [some workarounds](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1377#issuecomment-368498552), but they feels like a hacking.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: If a new version of the application is deployed , the VueX is not reactive until user does a hard refresh
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.1.2

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
Hi Team,

I am using the Vue 2 and the following VueX libraries,
"vuex": "^3.1.2",
"vuex-oidc": "^3.5.1",
"vuex-persistedstate": "^2.7.1"

My Issue:

this cannot be reproduced by code pen or sand box .

I am using a microfront-end, some of the modules developed by angular js and some of the modules are developed by vue js
user is working on application version-1, meanwhile the version-2 is deployed.
if user navigates to a page which is developed by Angular and if he comes back to the pages which is using vue js, I can see all the new changes but when I change the values in vuex.
The setter is working (vueX persisted store updating the localstorage) but getter is not (reactive) returning the new value.

### What is expected?
the state should be reactive

### What is actually happening?
The setter is working (vueX persisted store updating the localstorage) but getter is not (reactive) returning the new value.

---
if I do a refresh, it is working fine. but I wants to solve without a refresh.

is there anyway to solve the reactive issue of the VueX in this scenario?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Define state when preserved is true, but there is nothing to preserve
Issues.Body:
Vuex handles modules defined in the constructor options different from those registered with store.registerModule. For registerModule calls, the modules pass for a variety of checks before being embedded in the global store.

When checking in "installModule" if the module should be at the root and if the "state" should not be preserved is not observed that if "hot" is set to true, but the state was not defined before throws an error inside the mutation called to change state like "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'foo')".

That occurs because it was preserved a no existing state. That's why we should check if the state already exists if so, it will be preserved otherwise we set the default from the module. 

The fast way to verify this bug is creating a project from scratch, adding vuex, creating a module (I did it in a separate file), setting the namespace to true, registering it like "store.registerModule('bar', module, {preserveState:true})". Now at a vue file call from a a method "this.$store.dispatch('bar/setValue', {name:'foo'})".

Fixes #2083
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Define state when preserved is true, but there is nothing to preserve" (#2084)

Issues.Title: Define state when preserved is true, but there is no state to preserve
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/embed/optimistic-pine-hqsbc?fontsize=14&hidenavigation=1&theme=dark)







### Steps to reproduce
The fast way to verify this bug is creating a project from scratch, adding vuex, creating a module (I did it in a separate file), setting the namespace to true, registering it like "store.registerModule('bar', module, {preserveState:true})". Now at a vue file call from a a method "this.$store.dispatch('bar/setValue', {name:'foo'})".

### What is expected?
The value is to be set correctly.

### What is actually happening?
Throws a error. 

[Vue warn]: Error in v-on handler: "TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'user')"

---
Vuex handles modules defined in the constructor options different from those registered with store.registerModule. For registerModule calls, the modules pass for a variety of checks before being embedded in the global store.

When checking in "installModule" if the module should be at the root and if the "state" should not be preserved is not observed that if "hot" is set to true, but the state was not defined before throws an error inside the mutation called to change state like "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'foo')".

That occurs because it was preserved a no existing state. That's why we should check if the state already exists if so, it will be preserved otherwise we set the default from the module. 

I need the value to be preserved due to the vuex-persistedstate that I'm using and I don't want to get overridden, but at the same time if no state is to be preserved the module default state should be defined.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Define state when preserved is true, but there is no state to preserve" (#2083)
